description: Master Git and GitHub for version control and collaboration.

lessons.title: What is Git?
lessons.content: Understand version control and Git fundamentals.

lessons.title: Git Installation & Setup
lessons.content: Install and configure Git on your system.

lessons.title: Basic Commands (init, add, commit, push, clone)
lessons.content: Learn essential Git commands for daily development.

lessons.title: Branching and Merging
lessons.content: Work with branches to manage different versions of your code.

lessons.title: Working with GitHub Repositories
lessons.content: Collaborate with others using GitHub repositories.

lessons.title: Version Control Best Practices
lessons.content: Follow best practices for effective version control.

lessons.title: Mini Project: Manage a Demo Repo
lessons.content: Create and manage a complete Git repository for a demo project.

lessons.title: Branch Management
lessons.content: Master advanced branch management techniques including feature branches, release branches, and hotfix branches.

lessons.title: Merging & Resolving Conflicts
lessons.content: Learn how to merge branches effectively and resolve merge conflicts when they arise.

lessons.title: Working with Remote Repos
lessons.content: Deep dive into working with remote repositories, including fetching, pulling, and pushing changes.

lessons.title: Pull Requests & Collaboration Flow
lessons.content: Understand the pull request workflow for code review and collaborative development.

lessons.title: Git Ignore & Best Practices
lessons.content: Learn how to use .gitignore files effectively and follow Git best practices for clean repositories.

lessons.title: Undo & Reset Commands
lessons.content: Master Git's undo and reset commands to revert changes and fix mistakes.

lessons.title: Mini Project: Simulate Git Workflow Visualization
lessons.content: Create a visual representation of a complete Git workflow including branching, merging, and collaboration.
